repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Cletus Daniel Papers
did.abstract: This is a collection of research material that Professor Daniel collected during his tenure at the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations, Cornell University.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cletus Daniel Papers #/4288. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: /4073: James O. Morris Office Files /4290m: ILR School Dean's Office Memorial Statements /4297: ILR School Biography Files 5584: National Archives and Records Service Copies of Federal Documentation on Black Workers 5584 A: National Archives and Records Service Copies of Federal Documentation on Black Workers 5619/008: ACWA Rieve-Pollock Foundation Files 5981 P: ACTWU Labor Unity Photograph Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Titles with "RG" followed by alphanumeric codes indicate copies of material from the National Archives, with number codes indicating the record group to which each folder belongs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains undated photocopied research material throughout. Folder dates indicate the actual creation of the actual material, including photocopies and originals. Dates in titles indicate the date of source material, not the date of creation.

did.unittitle: The ACLU. and the Wagner Act: An Inquiry Into the Depression-Era Crisis of American Liberalism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft by Daniel. Includes copy of 1957 address by George W. Brooks, Director of Research and Education, International Brotherhood of Pulp Sulphite, and Paper Workers, "What Will Collective Bargaining Look Like in Twenty Years?"

did.unittitle: Chapter X Factories in the Field- Donald Von Eschon
Origins of Powerlessness: California Farmworkers in the Age of Organization and Reform- Chapter I-IV (Folder 1 of 2)

Notes, Documents Relating to Labor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains background resarch on agricultural labor in the 1930s as well as correspondence of JR Steelman.

did.unittitle: Papers Relating to Labor and Unions in the 1930s

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes US Department of Labor correspondence about agricultural labor disputes in California and other western states. Also includes typewritten notes on the 12th Communist District Secretariat and a memo on the Pacific Coast Secretariat, which "following out the Communist Party plans for more intensive activity on the Pacific Coast [...] will have jurisdiction over all Communistic activity along the coastal states as well as Nevada, Arizona, Utah, and Idaho."

did.unittitle: San Jose Cannery Strike, 1931 RG 13 170-6504
El Monte Strike, 1933 RG 13 170-8083

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material relating to Mexican farm laborers striking for higher wages against Japanese berry growers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material documents lead up to a strike motivated by Fruit and Vegetable Packers Association's demand for Immigration Services to investigate Japanese workers.

did.unittitle: Proceedings of Meeting No.1 of the Special Industrial Recovery Board and Letters to Government Officials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material related to the National Recovery Act. Also includes some material on Mexican agricultural workers.

did.unittitle: Seabrook Farms Strike, 1934 RG 13 170-9817 U.S. Commissioner of Conciliation Service
Legal Cases Relating to Agricultural Workers, Ironworkers, Bricklayers, Carpenters in California
Papers and Newspapers Relating to the IWW

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Bureau of Industrial Research pamphlet titled "Agriculture: The World's Basic Industry and Its Workers," "Twenty Fiver Years of Industrial Unionism" IWW pamphlet, various documents and newspaper clippings.

did.unittitle: Material Relating to the IWW and Labor Articles Relating to Agriculture
Howell "The IWW and the Espionage Act"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopied chapters of manuscript.

did.unittitle: Notes and Papers Relating to Labor and Agriculture in California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes "The Truth About the IWW Prisoners" (1922) pamphlet published by the American Civil Liberties Union, "War-time Prosecutions and Mob Violence" (1918) published by the National Civil Liberties Bureau, and Vol. 4, No. I, Whole Number 37 of The Industrial Pioneer (May 1926) (includes article by Eugene Debs, "Woman and Childhood"). Also includes typewritten manuscript "Justice Triumphant" written by a n anonymous author credited as "A Spectator." The manuscript discusses the Wheatlan Hop riot and the subsequent trials of the hop pickers.

did.unittitle: 1939 List of References on Migrants and Related Subjects in the State Relief Administration (SRA) Library
Social Science Research Council Bibliography of Pacific Coast Agricultural Labor
1934-1937 Papers Relating to Agriculture and Labor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopied correspondence with Gardner Jackson.

did.unittitle: 1935 Agricultural Workers and the Agricultural Adjustment Administration (AAA) Correspondence and Reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopied correspondence from Simon J. Lubin, Roger N. Bladwin, and others.

did.unittitle: Farm Workers Support, 1931-38
Philip Bancroft Interviews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopied transcript. Topics include "The Grapes of Wrath," the Associated Farmers, the LaFollettee Committee investigation, the AFL-CIO, the Teamsters, and farm labor.

did.unittitle: Wofford B, Camp Interviews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interview with Wofford B. Camp, USDA agronomist and influence on corporate farming. Topics include labor in the 1920s and 1930s, The Grapes of Wrath, Ella Winter, living facilities for farm laborers, and the the DiGiorgio Frams strike.

did.unittitle: Papers Relating to the Wagner Act and Labor Journals
Imperial Valley Strikes, 1930 U.S. Commissioner of Conciliation Service RG 13 170-5463
Origins of Powerlessness: California Farmworkers in the Age of Organization and Reform - Preface and Chapter 1-4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unpublished manuscript by Cletus E. Daniel

did.unittitle: Origins of Powerlessness: California Farmworkers in the Age of Organization and Reform- Chapter 4-8
San Francisco Examiner article manuscripts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript drafts of letters and articles for the San Francisco Examiner regarding labor organizing and communists in the Imperial Valley, including a piece by Philip S. Bancroft. Also includes issue of Trabajador Agricolo newspaper (Vol. 1 No. 1, December 20, 1933).

did.unittitle: Speeches Supporting Agricultural Unionism in the Imperial Valley
Reports on strikes and vigilante/police violence in Imperial Valley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains court documents and chronologies of strikes in Imperial Valley that led to police and vigilante violence against workers.

did.unittitle: Oxnard Beet Workers' Strike, 1933 U.S. Commissioner of Conciliation RG 13 170-9201 176-413

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes letters and reports to the Department of Labor on the Oxnard strikes, blaming outside communist agitators for Mexican and Filipino worker unrest.

did.unittitle: Articles About Communist Party and Imperial Valley
Fresno Bee, San Francisco Examiner citations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 1933 letter from District Attorney to TJ O'Donnell of the Palo Alto Democratic Club.

did.unittitle: ACLU and 1933 Cotton Strikes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopied letter to Roger Baldwin and essay by A.L. Wirin on the the 1933 cotton strike and criminal syndicalism laws.

did.unittitle: Anti-Filipino Activities in Salinas Valley, 1934

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes accounts of vigilante attack on Filipino labor camp from the Conference for Labor's Civil Rights and the Filipino Labor Union.

did.unittitle: ACLU Correspondence with General Pelham Glassford re: Imperial Valley strikes
Internal ACLU Correspondence re: Imperial Valley
Press re: Imperial Valley and other California agricultural Strikes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Northern California Political Prisoners Bulletin and National Committee for the Defense of Political Prisoners notable members list (which includes Langston Hughes and Edna St. Vincent Millay).

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous correspondences in Imperial Valley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with ACLU attorneys Wirin and Besig

did.unittitle: 1934 Imperial Valley correspondence, RG 13 170-7205 U.S. Commissioner of Conciliation Service

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of correspondence and news clippings regarding Imperial Valley strikes and violence against workers. Includes appeals to Franklin D. Roosevelt and Francis Perkins from the ACLU and labor groups as well as from the Chamber of Commerce and owners.

did.unittitle: 1936 Orange Pickers' Strike, U.S. Commissioner of Conciliation Service RG 13 182-1525

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of letters, telegrams, and news clippings related to the 1936 citrus strike in Orange County. Some telegrams and letters addressed to Franklin D. Roosevelt and Francis Perkins.
